Hello

My name is Daniel Ernesto Hernández Zelada, a Computer Science Student who loves all things programming, data science, infosec, theology, literature

Guatemala City, GT

GitHub LinkedIn Blog Good Reads Instagram Twitter Email

Experience

Computer Science

UFM or elsewhere

In sixth grade I discovered the Jailbreaking world in iOS and since then I've been experimenting with the Linux kernel and its various distributions and I've fallen in love with the UNIX world. This, in turn, led me to explore the InfoSec world, which is highly related to these operating systems. After having multple year of experience with Linux and the life I started studying CompSci on Universidad Francisco Marroquín and I have had many programming projects using different modern technologies to meet the goals set by the professors. From all the UNIX operating systems I've tried I love macOS the most because whilst using it I don't feel like there's a piece of software in between, I feel like I'm directly working on my ideas and I have come to realize that the reason for that is the great UX/UI which I aspire to design on all my projects.

Theology and Biblical Academics

Iglesia Vida Real.tv

When I was around 7 years old I confessed with my mouth that Jesus is Lord and believed in my heart that God raised Him from the dead thus I praying the Sinner's Prayer accepting Jesus as my Savior. Ever since, I have wanted to learn more about the God I believe. I've aimed to achieve this by using of the tools that my parents and fellow pastors and have lent me, such as hermeneutics, ecegetics, homiletics, linguistics and theological tools to study the Holy Scriptures. This curiosity led me to engage in deep conversations with the well-known Chilean theologian Gonzalo Chamorro who got me involved in a theological literary group where we discussed the transcendent questions of ἄνθρωπος (anthropos) and of θεός (Theos). Since then I've been reading many different academical books related to the Bible to further understand it and its important historical context. I've also started a Biblical-Academical blog which focuses on answering questions that the lay christian may ask themselves and might have some trouble answering, you can visit by going into "Blog" on the navbar.

Photography

@danisnowman & @vidarealtv

As a photographer I have learned to discuss requirements with clients, conduct research for each session, use technical equipment, network with other professionals, organize backgrounds for photo sessions, process images, and I have learned a lot about self-marketing. However, photographers are artists with a camera, thus using a mix of technical skills and an artistic eye I have developed the ability to take portrait, location, landscape or food photos that express meaning and are well understood. I have shot weddings, conferences, personal projects, street photography and religious services.

Robotics Team

Colegio Cristiano Biligüe El Shaddai

Since the ninth grade I was on my high school robotics team. Together with my friends we entered into many competitions at the local, national, Latin American and global levels. Winning many of them. We developed our robots and software in different platforms and languages, amongst my favourites I can mention Arduino which is particulary good for learning and VEX which was very good for competitions.

Education

Computer Science Engineering

Universidad Francisco Marroquín

In this three years I've been studying (I have one more left) the design of computers and computational systems both practical and theoretical systems. Unlike Systems Engineering students, I deal mostly with software and algorithms; this includes their theory, design, development, optimization and application.

High School

Colegio Cristiano Bilingüe El                            Shaddai z.16

I studied at this school since I was two years old, this helped me to strongly grow the values of perseverance and discipline. The intention of studying in a Christian school was to be able to develop friendships with values similar to those transmitted by my parents.

Photography

Freddy Murphy's Studio

In these courses given by the renowned Guatemalan photographer Freddy Murphy, I learned the different operations of a camera, such as how to handle lighting-- both artificial and natural, theory of photography, and Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom.
